body_content.explanation: to change something in order to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose:
examples: Politics is being retooled for a new audience.
We need to help workers retrain and retool their careers in areas of stable employment.
Even more changes are expected next year, as businesses re-tool their operations.

body_content.explanation: to provide a factory, industry, vehicle, etc. with new equipment or tools in order to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose:
examples: We should be retooling our factories to build solar panels and solar electricity.
In the retooled aeroplane of tomorrow, there will be a host of new security devices.
We need to re-tool the motor industry, reconfigure the power grid, and convert buildings into power plants.

body_content.explanation: (of a factory, industry, etc.) to get newer or different equipment in order to improve or become more suitable for a particular purpose:
examples: She said industries must retool for an innovation economy.
The money will help our auto companies re-tool, so that the fuel-efficient cars of the future are built right here in this country.

body_content.explanation: to get new skills or experience that are more suitable for a particular job, purpose, etc. than the skills or experience that you already have:
examples: Many students are retooling by getting more training in fields such as health care or computers.
